name: Intermediate French I
description: An integrated approach to the study of the French language and culture by means of grammar review, literary and cultural readings and analysis, and intensive practice in written and spoken French. This course explores definitions of culture and analyzes the dynamic role of language in culture and culture in language, with an aim to foster cross-cultural awareness and self-realization while developing proficiency in French. This course is designed to strengthen listening, speaking, reading and writing, within the context of evolving Frenchand Francophone cultures. Varying with each semester, the course will use classic French and Francophone texts as well as songs, excerpts from newspapers, magazines or films. Prerequisites or appropriate placement test score.
